alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Jefferson; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 18 at 3:34AM CDT until April 19 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 expected. For the second Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 30 expected. * WHERE...Washington, Marshall, Nemaha, Brown, Pottawatomie, Jackson and Jefferson Counties. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, until 8 AM CDT this morning. For the second Freeze Warning, from 3 AM to 9 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Jackson; Jefferson; Marshall; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Washington
